cont.entity_a: Subpar build quality with weak plastic pieces that break easily. Build quality issues with plastic breaking within months. So-so build quality, prone to breaking.
cont.entity_b: Poor design with inconsistent sound function and static issues. Batteries corroded within a week of use.

cont.entity_a: Comfortable to wear, sometimes forgetting they are on. Barely fits over the ears, causing discomfort. Uncomfortable hard clamp on the head can cause headaches.
cont.entity_b: Comfortable and excellent sound quality for the price. Loose fit, easily falls off the head. Comfortable fit but falls off easily.

cont.entity_a: Sound is crisp and clean. Balanced high and mid frequencies with decent lows. Lacks bass and distorts when maxed out. Sound is good but not comparable to more expensive brands. Sound quality is acceptable, but bass is weak.
cont.entity_b: Good sound quality for TV but not recommended for music. Good sound quality but plagued by static pops and clicks. Lacks noise cancellation, sound quality is decent. Good sound quality with long battery life. Static issues when not receiving a signal.

cont.entity_a: Cord is too short, restricting movement at a desk.
Good for blocking out ambient noise at home or the office.
Good value for headphones under $60, especially at $30.
Not comparable to high-end brands but comfortable and good for portable use.

cont.entity_b: Wireless technology is unsuitable for office environments. Easy operation with a physical switch and volume scroll wheel. Requires manual tuning, prone to frequency drift. Difficult setup, requiring additional equipment for compatibility. Difficult tuning and volume adjustment.
Stopped working after 2.5 years, broadcasting only static.
Solved hearing problems for TV watching. Improves TV dialogue clarity significantly. Easy setup with good sound for TV watching. Clear voice for TV, but falls off when moving.
